title: SFH on review of Hospital Authority
content_text:
p>
	Following is the transcript of remarks made by the Secretary for Food and 
	Health, Dr Ko Wing-man, after attending a public function today (April 1): Reporter: (On recommendations of the Steering Committee on Review of 
	Hospital Authority.) Secretary for Food and Health: The Steering Committee on Review of Hospital 
	Authority held the last meeting yesterday. At the meeting, the Steering 
	Committee members went through the first complete draft of the committee 
	report. Members generally feel that the report has reflected what they had

report. Members generally feel that the report has reflected what they had 
	suggested. The report is the result of an extensive consultation with the 
	community, the staff of the Hospital Authority and professional 
	organisations. In the report, there are major recommendations which will 
	have significant impacts on the onward development and the management of the 
	Hospital Authority. One of the major recommendations is the internal 
	resource allocation mechanism which suggests the Hospital Authority to adopt 
	a population-based funding model. Of course, we would have to allow the

a population-based funding model. Of course, we would have to allow the 
	Hospital Authority some time to migrate towards this system of resource 
	allocation. In the interim, the Government will earmark certain resources to 
	supplement those hospital clusters which face particular difficulties. We 
	anticipate that the report will be completed within the first half of this 
	year. By that time, we will introduce the report to the Hospital Authority 
	and the Legislative Council. I will also announce the report in detail to 
	the public. (Please also refer to the
the public. (Please also refer to the Chinese portion of the transcript.)
